steps: Wash and scrub the red potatoes thoroughly to remove any dirt
Peel the potatoes and cut into evenly sized pieces, about 2.5cm to 4cm in diameter. This ensures they cook evenly.
Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water.
Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the potatoes are barely tender when pierced with a fork, about 5 minutes.
Pour the oil into a large oven proof dish and place in the oven for 5 minutes to heat the oil.
Drain the potatoes in a colander and let them sit for a few minutes to dry off slightly.
Return the potatoes to the saucepan with the ehat turned off.
Add the thyme and salt to the potatoes.
Place the lid on the saucepan and give it a good shake to rough up the edges of the potatoes.
Take the oven proof dish out of the oven and carefully add the potatoes to the hot oil. Then turn and roll them around so they are coated all over.
Spread them in a single layer making sure they have plenty of room.
Roast the potatoes for 15 mins, then take them out of the oven and turn them over.
Put them back in the oven for 10-20 minutes, until they are golden brown and crispy all over.
Serve your delicious roasties with your favourite roast dinner.
